library-construction-16s-rrna-based_pcr_: The DNA was amplified with Genomiphi kits (Amersham; Ø-29 DNA polymerase) for 18 hours in a thermal cycler, using multiple 20 μl reactions containing 50-100 ng of the isolated DNA as template
sample-isolation-and-treatment_sample_is: Seawater samples (10 to 200 liters) were prefiltered through 142 mm-diameter glass fiber filters (1.2 μm nominal pore-size: type GC50, Advantec MFS, Dublin, CA, or 0.7 μm nominal pore-size: type GF/F, Whatman, Clifton, NJ) followed by either 0.45-μm-pore-size (type GVWP, Millipore, Bedford, MA) or 0.2 μmpore- size (Gelman, East Hills, NY) membrane filters. Virus-sized particles in the filtrate were concentrated ca. 50- to 700-fold by ultrafiltration using a 10 or 30 kDa-cutoff Amicon/Millipore (S1Y10/S1Y30/S10Y30) spiral cartridge and then stored at 4°C in the 2 dark. One milliliter of each virus concentrate (VC) was combined into a mix. The Gulf of Mexico mix consisted of 41 different virus communities (3.65 x 1010 vlps per ml).
sample-origin_depth: western GOM = surface to 164, Eastern GOM =3 to 90, Northeastern GOM = 1 to 120,  Texas Coast = 1 to 120
sample-origin_temperature: western GOM = 20.2 to 30.5, Eastern GOM =21.6 to 30.0, Northeastern GOM = 18.7 to 30.0,  Texas Coast = 14.7 to 30.5
water_salinity: Western GOM = 36.2 to 36.4, Texas Coast = 26.1 to 40.6, Northeast GOM = 31.5 to 36.6, Eastern GOM =33.5 to 36.6
